00072 /*****************************************************************************/
00073 
00076 void ec_fsm_master_init(
00077         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm, 
00078         ec_master_t *master, 
00079         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00080         )
00081 {
00082     fsm->master = master;
00083     fsm->datagram = datagram;
00084 
00085     ec_fsm_master_reset(fsm);
00086 
00087     // init sub-state-machines
00088     ec_fsm_coe_init(&fsm->fsm_coe);
00089     ec_fsm_soe_init(&fsm->fsm_soe);
00090     ec_fsm_pdo_init(&fsm->fsm_pdo, &fsm->fsm_coe);
00091     ec_fsm_change_init(&fsm->fsm_change, fsm->datagram);
00092     ec_fsm_slave_config_init(&fsm->fsm_slave_config, fsm->datagram,
00093             &fsm->fsm_change, &fsm->fsm_coe, &fsm->fsm_soe, &fsm->fsm_pdo);
00094     ec_fsm_slave_scan_init(&fsm->fsm_slave_scan, fsm->datagram,
00095             &fsm->fsm_slave_config, &fsm->fsm_pdo);
00096     ec_fsm_sii_init(&fsm->fsm_sii, fsm->datagram);
00097 }
00098 
00099 /*****************************************************************************/
00100 
00103 void ec_fsm_master_clear(
00104         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00105         )
00106 {
00107     // clear sub-state machines
00108     ec_fsm_coe_clear(&fsm->fsm_coe);
00109     ec_fsm_soe_clear(&fsm->fsm_soe);
00110     ec_fsm_pdo_clear(&fsm->fsm_pdo);
00111     ec_fsm_change_clear(&fsm->fsm_change);
00112     ec_fsm_slave_config_clear(&fsm->fsm_slave_config);
00113     ec_fsm_slave_scan_clear(&fsm->fsm_slave_scan);
00114     ec_fsm_sii_clear(&fsm->fsm_sii);
00115 }
00116 
00117 /*****************************************************************************/
00118 
00121 void ec_fsm_master_reset(
00122         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00123         )
00124 {
00125     ec_device_index_t dev_idx;
00126 
00127     fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_start;
00128     fsm->idle = 0;
00129     fsm->dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00130 
00131     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00132             dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(fsm->master); dev_idx++) {
00133         fsm->link_state[dev_idx] = 0;
00134         fsm->slaves_responding[dev_idx] = 0;
00135         fsm->slave_states[dev_idx] = EC_SLAVE_STATE_UNKNOWN;
00136     }
00137 
00138     fsm->rescan_required = 0;
00139 }
00140 
00141 /*****************************************************************************/
00142 
00150 int ec_fsm_master_exec(
00151         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00152         )
00153 {
00154     if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_SENT
00155         || fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED) {
00156         // datagram was not sent or received yet.
00157         return 0;
00158     }
00159 
00160     fsm->state(fsm);
00161     return 1;
00162 }
00163 
00164 /*****************************************************************************/
00165 
00169 int ec_fsm_master_idle(
00170         const ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00171         )
00172 {
00173     return fsm->idle;
00174 }
00175 
00176 /*****************************************************************************/
00177 
00180 void ec_fsm_master_restart(
00181         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00182         )
00183 {
00184     fsm->dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00185     fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_start;
00186     fsm->state(fsm); // execute immediately
00187 }
00188 
00189 /******************************************************************************
00190  * Master state machine
00191  *****************************************************************************/
00192 
00197 void ec_fsm_master_state_start(
00198         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00199         )
00200 {
00201     fsm->idle = 1;
00202     ec_datagram_brd(fsm->datagram, 0x0130, 2);
00203     ec_datagram_zero(fsm->datagram);
00204     fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->dev_idx;
00205     fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_broadcast;
00206 }
00207 
00208 /*****************************************************************************/
00209 
00214 void ec_fsm_master_state_broadcast(
00215         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00216         )
00217 {
00218     ec_datagram_t *datagram = fsm->datagram;
00219     unsigned int i, size;
00220     ec_slave_t *slave;
00221     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00222 
00223     // bus topology change?
00224     if (datagram->working_counter != fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx]) {
00225         fsm->rescan_required = 1;
00226         fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx] = datagram->working_counter;
00227         EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "%u slave(s) responding on %s device.\n",
00228                 fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx],
00229                 ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0]);
00230     }
00231 
00232     if (fsm->link_state[fsm->dev_idx] &&
00233             !master->devices[fsm->dev_idx].link_state) {
00234         ec_device_index_t dev_idx;
00235 
00236         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Master state machine detected "
00237                 "link down on %s device. Clearing slave list.\n",
00238                 ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0]);
00239 
00240 #ifdef EC_EOE
00241         ec_master_eoe_stop(master);
00242         ec_master_clear_eoe_handlers(master);
00243 #endif
00244         ec_master_clear_slaves(master);
00245 
00246         for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00247                 dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master); dev_idx++) {
00248             fsm->slave_states[dev_idx] = 0x00;
00249             fsm->slaves_responding[dev_idx] = 0; /* Reset to trigger rescan on
00250                                                     next link up. */
00251         }
00252     }
00253     fsm->link_state[fsm->dev_idx] = master->devices[fsm->dev_idx].link_state;
00254 
00255     if (datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED &&
00256             fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx]) {
00257         uint8_t states = EC_READ_U8(datagram->data);
00258         if (states != fsm->slave_states[fsm->dev_idx]) {
00259             // slave states changed
00260             char state_str[EC_STATE_STRING_SIZE];
00261             fsm->slave_states[fsm->dev_idx] = states;
00262             ec_state_string(states, state_str, 1);
00263             EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Slave states on %s device: %s.\n",
00264                     ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0], state_str);
00265         }
00266     } else {
00267         fsm->slave_states[fsm->dev_idx] = 0x00;
00268     }
00269 
00270     fsm->dev_idx++;
00271     if (fsm->dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master)) {
00272         // check number of responding slaves on next device
00273         fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_start;
00274         fsm->state(fsm); // execute immediately
00275         return;
00276     }
00277 
00278     if (fsm->rescan_required) {
00279         down(&master->scan_sem);
00280         if (!master->allow_scan) {
00281             up(&master->scan_sem);
00282         } else {
00283             unsigned int count = 0, next_dev_slave, ring_position;
00284             ec_device_index_t dev_idx;
00285 
00286             master->scan_busy = 1;
00287             up(&master->scan_sem);
00288 
00289             // clear all slaves and scan the bus
00290             fsm->rescan_required = 0;
00291             fsm->idle = 0;
00292             fsm->scan_jiffies = jiffies;
00293 
00294 #ifdef EC_EOE
00295             ec_master_eoe_stop(master);
00296             ec_master_clear_eoe_handlers(master);
00297 #endif
00298             ec_master_clear_slaves(master);
00299 
00300             for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00301                     dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master); dev_idx++) {
00302                 count += fsm->slaves_responding[dev_idx];
00303             }
00304 
00305             if (!count) {
00306                 // no slaves present -> finish state machine.
00307                 master->scan_busy = 0;
00308                 wake_up_interruptible(&master->scan_queue);
00309                 ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00310                 return;
00311             }
00312 
00313             size = sizeof(ec_slave_t) * count;
00314             if (!(master->slaves =
00315                         (ec_slave_t *) kmalloc(size, GFP_KERNEL))) {
00316                 EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to allocate %u bytes"
00317                         " of slave memory!\n", size);
00318                 master->scan_busy = 0;
00319                 wake_up_interruptible(&master->scan_queue);
00320                 ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00321                 return;
00322             }
00323 
00324             // init slaves
00325             dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00326             next_dev_slave = fsm->slaves_responding[dev_idx];
00327             ring_position = 0;
00328             for (i = 0; i < count; i++, ring_position++) {
00329                 slave = master->slaves + i;
00330                 while (i >= next_dev_slave) {
00331                     dev_idx++;
00332                     next_dev_slave += fsm->slaves_responding[dev_idx];
00333                     ring_position = 0;
00334                 }
00335 
00336                 ec_slave_init(slave, master, dev_idx, ring_position, i + 1);
00337 
00338                 // do not force reconfiguration in operation phase to avoid
00339                 // unnecesssary process data interruptions
00340                 if (master->phase != EC_OPERATION) {
00341                     slave->force_config = 1;
00342                 }
00343             }
00344             master->slave_count = count;
00345             master->fsm_slave = master->slaves;
00346 
00347             /* start with first device with slaves responding; at least one
00348              * has responding slaves, otherwise count would be zero. */
00349             fsm->dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00350             while (!fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx]) {
00351                 fsm->dev_idx++;
00352             }
00353 
00354             ec_fsm_master_enter_clear_addresses(fsm);
00355             return;
00356         }
00357     }
00358 
00359     if (master->slave_count) {
00360 
00361         // application applied configurations
00362         if (master->config_changed) {
00363             master->config_changed = 0;
00364 
00365             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Configuration changed.\n");
00366 
00367             fsm->slave = master->slaves; // begin with first slave
00368             ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
00369 
00370         } else {
00371             // fetch state from first slave
00372             fsm->slave = master->slaves;
00373             ec_datagram_fprd(fsm->datagram, fsm->slave->station_address,
00374                     0x0130, 2);
00375             ec_datagram_zero(datagram);
00376             fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->slave->device_index;
00377             fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00378             fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_read_state;
00379         }
00380     } else {
00381         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00382     }
00383 }
00384 
00385 /*****************************************************************************/
00386 
00391 int ec_fsm_master_action_process_sii(
00392         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00393         )
00394 {
00395     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00396     ec_sii_write_request_t *request;
00397 
00398     // search the first request to be processed
00399     while (1) {
00400         if (list_empty(&master->sii_requests))
00401             break;
00402 
00403         // get first request
00404         request = list_entry(master->sii_requests.next,
00405                 ec_sii_write_request_t, list);
00406         list_del_init(&request->list); // dequeue
00407         request->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_BUSY;
00408 
00409         // found pending SII write operation. execute it!
00410         EC_SLAVE_DBG(request->slave, 1, "Writing SII data...\n");
00411         fsm->sii_request = request;
00412         fsm->sii_index = 0;
00413         ec_fsm_sii_write(&fsm->fsm_sii, request->slave, request->offset,
00414                 request->words, EC_FSM_SII_USE_CONFIGURED_ADDRESS);
00415         fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_write_sii;
00416         fsm->state(fsm); // execute immediately
00417         return 1;
00418     }
00419 
00420     return 0;
00421 }
00422 
00423 /*****************************************************************************/
00424 
00429 int ec_fsm_master_action_process_sdo(
00430         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00431         )
00432 {
00433     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00434     ec_slave_t *slave;
00435     ec_sdo_request_t *req;
00436 
00437     // search for internal requests to be processed
00438     for (slave = master->slaves;
00439             slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
00440             slave++) {
00441 
00442         if (!slave->config) {
00443             continue;
00444         }
00445 
00446         list_for_each_entry(req, &slave->config->sdo_requests, list) {
00447             if (req->state == EC_INT_REQUEST_QUEUED) {
00448 
00449                 if (ec_sdo_request_timed_out(req)) {
00450                     req->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_FAILURE;
00451                     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Internal SDO request"
00452                             " timed out.\n");
00453                     continue;
00454                 }
00455 
00456                 if (slave->current_state == EC_SLAVE_STATE_INIT) {
00457                     req->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_FAILURE;
00458                     continue;
00459                 }
00460 
00461                 req->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_BUSY;
00462                 EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Processing internal"
00463                         " SDO request...\n");
00464                 fsm->idle = 0;
00465                 fsm->sdo_request = req;
00466                 fsm->slave = slave;
00467                 fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_sdo_request;
00468                 ec_fsm_coe_transfer(&fsm->fsm_coe, slave, req);
00469                 ec_fsm_coe_exec(&fsm->fsm_coe, fsm->datagram);
00470                 return 1;
00471             }
00472         }
00473     }
00474     return 0;
00475 }
00476 
00477 /*****************************************************************************/
00478 
00483 void ec_fsm_master_action_idle(
00484         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00485         )
00486 {
00487     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00488     ec_slave_t *slave;
00489 
00490     // Check for pending internal SDO requests
00491     if (ec_fsm_master_action_process_sdo(fsm)) {
00492         return;
00493     }
00494 
00495     // enable processing of requests
00496     for (slave = master->slaves;
00497             slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
00498             slave++) {
00499         ec_fsm_slave_set_ready(&slave->fsm);
00500     }
00501 
00502     // check, if slaves have an SDO dictionary to read out.
00503     for (slave = master->slaves;
00504             slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count;
00505             slave++) {
00506         if (!(slave->sii.mailbox_protocols & EC_MBOX_COE)
00507                 || (slave->sii.has_general
00508                     && !slave->sii.coe_details.enable_sdo_info)
00509                 || slave->sdo_dictionary_fetched
00510                 || slave->current_state == EC_SLAVE_STATE_INIT
00511                 || slave->current_state == EC_SLAVE_STATE_UNKNOWN
00512                 || jiffies - slave->jiffies_preop < EC_WAIT_SDO_DICT * HZ
00513                 ) continue;
00514 
00515         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Fetching SDO dictionary.\n");
00516 
00517         slave->sdo_dictionary_fetched = 1;
00518 
00519         // start fetching SDO dictionary
00520         fsm->idle = 0;
00521         fsm->slave = slave;
00522         fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_sdo_dictionary;
00523         ec_fsm_coe_dictionary(&fsm->fsm_coe, slave);
00524         ec_fsm_coe_exec(&fsm->fsm_coe, fsm->datagram); // execute immediately
00525         fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->slave->device_index;
00526         return;
00527     }
00528 
00529     // check for pending SII write operations.
00530     if (ec_fsm_master_action_process_sii(fsm)) {
00531         return; // SII write request found
00532     }
00533 
00534     ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00535 }
00536 
00537 /*****************************************************************************/
00538 
00541 void ec_fsm_master_action_next_slave_state(
00542         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00543         )
00544 {
00545     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00546 
00547     // is there another slave to query?
00548     fsm->slave++;
00549     if (fsm->slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count) {
00550         // fetch state from next slave
00551         fsm->idle = 1;
00552         ec_datagram_fprd(fsm->datagram,
00553                 fsm->slave->station_address, 0x0130, 2);
00554         ec_datagram_zero(fsm->datagram);
00555         fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->slave->device_index;
00556         fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00557         fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_read_state;
00558         return;
00559     }
00560 
00561     // all slaves processed
00562     ec_fsm_master_action_idle(fsm);
00563 }
00564 
00565 /*****************************************************************************/
00566 
00569 void ec_fsm_master_action_configure(
00570         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00571         )
00572 {
00573     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00574     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00575 
00576     if (master->config_changed) {
00577         master->config_changed = 0;
00578 
00579         // abort iterating through slaves,
00580         // first compensate DC system time offsets,
00581         // then begin configuring at slave 0
00582         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Configuration changed"
00583                 " (aborting state check).\n");
00584 
00585         fsm->slave = master->slaves; // begin with first slave
00586         ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
00587         return;
00588     }
00589 
00590     // Does the slave have to be configured?
00591     if ((slave->current_state != slave->requested_state
00592                 || slave->force_config) && !slave->error_flag) {
00593 
00594         // Start slave configuration
00595         down(&master->config_sem);
00596         master->config_busy = 1;
00597         up(&master->config_sem);
00598 
00599         if (master->debug_level) {
00600             char old_state[EC_STATE_STRING_SIZE],
00601                  new_state[EC_STATE_STRING_SIZE];
00602             ec_state_string(slave->current_state, old_state, 0);
00603             ec_state_string(slave->requested_state, new_state, 0);
00604             EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Changing state from %s to %s%s.\n",
00605                     old_state, new_state,
00606                     slave->force_config ? " (forced)" : "");
00607         }
00608 
00609         fsm->idle = 0;
00610         fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_configure_slave;
00611         ec_fsm_slave_config_start(&fsm->fsm_slave_config, slave);
00612         fsm->state(fsm); // execute immediately
00613         fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->slave->device_index;
00614         return;
00615     }
00616 
00617     // process next slave
00618     ec_fsm_master_action_next_slave_state(fsm);
00619 }
00620 
00621 /*****************************************************************************/
00622 
00627 void ec_fsm_master_state_read_state(
00628         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00629         )
00630 {
00631     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00632     ec_datagram_t *datagram = fsm->datagram;
00633 
00634     if (datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00635         return;
00636     }
00637 
00638     if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00639         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive AL state datagram: ");
00640         ec_datagram_print_state(datagram);
00641         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00642         return;
00643     }
00644 
00645     // did the slave not respond to its station address?
00646     if (datagram->working_counter != 1) {
00647         if (!slave->error_flag) {
00648             slave->error_flag = 1;
00649             EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Slave did not respond to state query.\n");
00650         }
00651         fsm->rescan_required = 1;
00652         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00653         return;
00654     }
00655 
00656     // A single slave responded
00657     ec_slave_set_state(slave, EC_READ_U8(datagram->data));
00658 
00659     if (!slave->error_flag) {
00660         // Check, if new slave state has to be acknowledged
00661         if (slave->current_state & EC_SLAVE_STATE_ACK_ERR) {
00662             fsm->idle = 0;
00663             fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_acknowledge;
00664             ec_fsm_change_ack(&fsm->fsm_change, slave);
00665             fsm->state(fsm); // execute immediately
00666             return;
00667         }
00668 
00669         // No acknowlegde necessary; check for configuration
00670         ec_fsm_master_action_configure(fsm);
00671         return;
00672     }
00673 
00674     // slave has error flag set; process next one
00675     ec_fsm_master_action_next_slave_state(fsm);
00676 }
00677 
00678 /*****************************************************************************/
00679 
00682 void ec_fsm_master_state_acknowledge(
00683         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00684         )
00685 {
00686     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00687 
00688     if (ec_fsm_change_exec(&fsm->fsm_change)) {
00689         return;
00690     }
00691 
00692     if (!ec_fsm_change_success(&fsm->fsm_change)) {
00693         fsm->slave->error_flag = 1;
00694         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to acknowledge state change.\n");
00695     }
00696 
00697     ec_fsm_master_action_configure(fsm);
00698 }
00699 
00700 /*****************************************************************************/
00701 
00704 void ec_fsm_master_enter_clear_addresses(
00705         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00706         )
00707 {
00708     // broadcast clear all station addresses
00709     ec_datagram_bwr(fsm->datagram, 0x0010, 2);
00710     EC_WRITE_U16(fsm->datagram->data, 0x0000);
00711     fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->dev_idx;
00712     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00713     fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_clear_addresses;
00714 }
00715 
00716 /*****************************************************************************/
00717 
00720 void ec_fsm_master_state_clear_addresses(
00721         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00722         )
00723 {
00724     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00725     ec_datagram_t *datagram = fsm->datagram;
00726 
00727     if (datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00728         return;
00729     }
00730 
00731     if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00732         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to receive address"
00733                 " clearing datagram on %s link: ",
00734                 ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0]);
00735         ec_datagram_print_state(datagram);
00736         master->scan_busy = 0;
00737         wake_up_interruptible(&master->scan_queue);
00738         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00739         return;
00740     }
00741 
00742     if (datagram->working_counter != fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx]) {
00743         EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "Failed to clear station addresses on %s link:"
00744                 " Cleared %u of %u",
00745                 ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0], datagram->working_counter,
00746                 fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx]);
00747     }
00748 
00749     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Sending broadcast-write"
00750             " to measure transmission delays on %s link.\n",
00751             ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0]);
00752 
00753     ec_datagram_bwr(datagram, 0x0900, 1);
00754     ec_datagram_zero(datagram);
00755     fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->dev_idx;
00756     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00757     fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_dc_measure_delays;
00758 }
00759 
00760 /*****************************************************************************/
00761 
00764 void ec_fsm_master_state_dc_measure_delays(
00765         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00766         )
00767 {
00768     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00769     ec_datagram_t *datagram = fsm->datagram;
00770 
00771     if (datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00772         return;
00773     }
00774 
00775     if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00776         EC_MASTER_ERR(master, "Failed to receive delay measuring datagram"
00777                 " on %s link: ", ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0]);
00778         ec_datagram_print_state(datagram);
00779         master->scan_busy = 0;
00780         wake_up_interruptible(&master->scan_queue);
00781         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00782         return;
00783     }
00784 
00785     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "%u slaves responded to delay measuring"
00786             " on %s link.\n",
00787             datagram->working_counter, ec_device_names[fsm->dev_idx != 0]);
00788 
00789     do {
00790         fsm->dev_idx++;
00791     } while (fsm->dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master) &&
00792             !fsm->slaves_responding[fsm->dev_idx]);
00793     if (fsm->dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master)) {
00794         ec_fsm_master_enter_clear_addresses(fsm);
00795         return;
00796     }
00797 
00798     EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Scanning bus.\n");
00799 
00800     // begin scanning of slaves
00801     fsm->slave = master->slaves;
00802     EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Scanning slave %u on %s link.\n",
00803             fsm->slave->ring_position,
00804             ec_device_names[fsm->slave->device_index != 0]);
00805     fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_scan_slave;
00806     ec_fsm_slave_scan_start(&fsm->fsm_slave_scan, fsm->slave);
00807     ec_fsm_slave_scan_exec(&fsm->fsm_slave_scan); // execute immediately
00808     fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->slave->device_index;
00809 }
00810 
00811 /*****************************************************************************/
00812 
00817 void ec_fsm_master_state_scan_slave(
00818         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00819         )
00820 {
00821     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00822 #ifdef EC_EOE
00823     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00824 #endif
00825 
00826     if (ec_fsm_slave_scan_exec(&fsm->fsm_slave_scan)) {
00827         return;
00828     }
00829 
00830 #ifdef EC_EOE
00831     if (slave->sii.mailbox_protocols & EC_MBOX_EOE) {
00832         // create EoE handler for this slave
00833         ec_eoe_t *eoe;
00834         if (!(eoe = kmalloc(sizeof(ec_eoe_t), GFP_KERNEL))) {
00835             EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to allocate EoE handler memory!\n");
00836         } else if (ec_eoe_init(eoe, slave)) {
00837             EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to init EoE handler!\n");
00838             kfree(eoe);
00839         } else {
00840             list_add_tail(&eoe->list, &master->eoe_handlers);
00841         }
00842     }
00843 #endif
00844 
00845     // another slave to fetch?
00846     fsm->slave++;
00847     if (fsm->slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count) {
00848         EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "Scanning slave %u on %s link.\n",
00849                 fsm->slave->ring_position,
00850                 ec_device_names[fsm->slave->device_index != 0]);
00851         ec_fsm_slave_scan_start(&fsm->fsm_slave_scan, fsm->slave);
00852         ec_fsm_slave_scan_exec(&fsm->fsm_slave_scan); // execute immediately
00853         fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->slave->device_index;
00854         return;
00855     }
00856 
00857     EC_MASTER_INFO(master, "Bus scanning completed in %lu ms.\n",
00858             (jiffies - fsm->scan_jiffies) * 1000 / HZ);
00859 
00860     master->scan_busy = 0;
00861     wake_up_interruptible(&master->scan_queue);
00862 
00863     ec_master_calc_dc(master);
00864 
00865     // Attach slave configurations
00866     ec_master_attach_slave_configs(master);
00867 
00868 #ifdef EC_EOE
00869     // check if EoE processing has to be started
00870     ec_master_eoe_start(master);
00871 #endif
00872 
00873     if (master->slave_count) {
00874         master->config_changed = 0;
00875 
00876         fsm->slave = master->slaves; // begin with first slave
00877         ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
00878     } else {
00879         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00880     }
00881 }
00882 
00883 /*****************************************************************************/
00884 
00889 void ec_fsm_master_state_configure_slave(
00890         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00891         )
00892 {
00893     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00894 
00895     if (ec_fsm_slave_config_exec(&fsm->fsm_slave_config)) {
00896         return;
00897     }
00898 
00899     fsm->slave->force_config = 0;
00900 
00901     // configuration finished
00902     master->config_busy = 0;
00903     wake_up_interruptible(&master->config_queue);
00904 
00905     if (!ec_fsm_slave_config_success(&fsm->fsm_slave_config)) {
00906         // TODO: mark slave_config as failed.
00907     }
00908 
00909     fsm->idle = 1;
00910     ec_fsm_master_action_next_slave_state(fsm);
00911 }
00912 
00913 /*****************************************************************************/
00914 
00917 void ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(
00918         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
00919         )
00920 {
00921     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
00922 
00923     if (master->has_app_time) {
00924 
00925         while (fsm->slave < master->slaves + master->slave_count) {
00926             if (!fsm->slave->base_dc_supported
00927                     || !fsm->slave->has_dc_system_time) {
00928                 fsm->slave++;
00929                 continue;
00930             }
00931 
00932             EC_SLAVE_DBG(fsm->slave, 1, "Checking system time offset.\n");
00933 
00934             // read DC system time (0x0910, 64 bit)
00935             //                         gap (64 bit)
00936             //     and time offset (0x0920, 64 bit)
00937             ec_datagram_fprd(fsm->datagram, fsm->slave->station_address,
00938                     0x0910, 24);
00939             fsm->datagram->device_index = fsm->slave->device_index;
00940             fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00941             fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_dc_read_offset;
00942             return;
00943         }
00944 
00945     } else {
00946         if (master->active) {
00947             EC_MASTER_WARN(master, "No app_time received up to now,"
00948                     " but master already active.\n");
00949         } else {
00950             EC_MASTER_DBG(master, 1, "No app_time received up to now.\n");
00951         }
00952     }
00953 
00954     // scanning and setting system times complete
00955     ec_master_request_op(master);
00956     ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
00957 }
00958 
00959 /*****************************************************************************/
00960 
00965 u64 ec_fsm_master_dc_offset32(
00966         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm, 
00967         u64 system_time, 
00968         u64 old_offset, 
00969         unsigned long jiffies_since_read 
00970         )
00971 {
00972     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00973     u32 correction, system_time32, old_offset32, new_offset;
00974     s32 time_diff;
00975 
00976     system_time32 = (u32) system_time;
00977     old_offset32 = (u32) old_offset;
00978 
00979     // correct read system time by elapsed time since read operation
00980     correction = jiffies_since_read * 1000 / HZ * 1000000;
00981     system_time32 += correction;
00982     time_diff = (u32) slave->master->app_time - system_time32;
00983 
00984     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "DC 32 bit system time offset calculation:"
00985             " system_time=%u (corrected with %u),"
00986             " app_time=%llu, diff=%i\n",
00987             system_time32, correction,
00988             slave->master->app_time, time_diff);
00989 
00990     if (EC_ABS(time_diff) > EC_SYSTEM_TIME_TOLERANCE_NS) {
00991         new_offset = time_diff + old_offset32;
00992         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Setting time offset to %u (was %u)\n",
00993                 new_offset, old_offset32);
00994         return (u64) new_offset;
00995     } else {
00996         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Not touching time offset.\n");
00997         return old_offset;
00998     }
00999 }
01000 
01001 /*****************************************************************************/
01002 
01007 u64 ec_fsm_master_dc_offset64(
01008         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm, 
01009         u64 system_time, 
01010         u64 old_offset, 
01011         unsigned long jiffies_since_read 
01012         )
01013 {
01014     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
01015     u64 new_offset, correction;
01016     s64 time_diff;
01017 
01018     // correct read system time by elapsed time since read operation
01019     correction = (u64) (jiffies_since_read * 1000 / HZ) * 1000000;
01020     system_time += correction;
01021     time_diff = fsm->slave->master->app_time - system_time;
01022 
01023     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "DC 64 bit system time offset calculation:"
01024             " system_time=%llu (corrected with %llu),"
01025             " app_time=%llu, diff=%lli\n",
01026             system_time, correction,
01027             slave->master->app_time, time_diff);
01028 
01029     if (EC_ABS(time_diff) > EC_SYSTEM_TIME_TOLERANCE_NS) {
01030         new_offset = time_diff + old_offset;
01031         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Setting time offset to %llu (was %llu)\n",
01032                 new_offset, old_offset);
01033     } else {
01034         new_offset = old_offset;
01035         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Not touching time offset.\n");
01036     }
01037 
01038     return new_offset;
01039 }
01040 
01041 /*****************************************************************************/
01042 
01045 void ec_fsm_master_state_dc_read_offset(
01046         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
01047         )
01048 {
01049     ec_datagram_t *datagram = fsm->datagram;
01050     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
01051     u64 system_time, old_offset, new_offset;
01052     unsigned long jiffies_since_read;
01053 
01054     if (datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--)
01055         return;
01056 
01057     if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
01058         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive DC times datagram: ");
01059         ec_datagram_print_state(datagram);
01060         fsm->slave++;
01061         ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
01062         return;
01063     }
01064 
01065     if (datagram->working_counter != 1) {
01066         EC_SLAVE_WARN(slave, "Failed to get DC times: ");
01067         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(datagram);
01068         fsm->slave++;
01069         ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
01070         return;
01071     }
01072 
01073     system_time = EC_READ_U64(datagram->data);     // 0x0910
01074     old_offset = EC_READ_U64(datagram->data + 16); // 0x0920
01075     jiffies_since_read = jiffies - datagram->jiffies_sent;
01076 
01077     if (slave->base_dc_range == EC_DC_32) {
01078         new_offset = ec_fsm_master_dc_offset32(fsm,
01079                 system_time, old_offset, jiffies_since_read);
01080     } else {
01081         new_offset = ec_fsm_master_dc_offset64(fsm,
01082                 system_time, old_offset, jiffies_since_read);
01083     }
01084 
01085     // set DC system time offset and transmission delay
01086     ec_datagram_fpwr(datagram, slave->station_address, 0x0920, 12);
01087     EC_WRITE_U64(datagram->data, new_offset);
01088     EC_WRITE_U32(datagram->data + 8, slave->transmission_delay);
01089     fsm->datagram->device_index = slave->device_index;
01090     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
01091     fsm->state = ec_fsm_master_state_dc_write_offset;
01092 }
01093 
01094 /*****************************************************************************/
01095 
01098 void ec_fsm_master_state_dc_write_offset(
01099         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
01100         )
01101 {
01102     ec_datagram_t *datagram = fsm->datagram;
01103     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
01104 
01105     if (datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--)
01106         return;
01107 
01108     if (datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
01109         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave,
01110                 "Failed to receive DC system time offset datagram: ");
01111         ec_datagram_print_state(datagram);
01112         fsm->slave++;
01113         ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
01114         return;
01115     }
01116 
01117     if (datagram->working_counter != 1) {
01118         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to set DC system time offset: ");
01119         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(datagram);
01120         fsm->slave++;
01121         ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
01122         return;
01123     }
01124 
01125     fsm->slave++;
01126     ec_fsm_master_enter_write_system_times(fsm);
01127 }
01128 
01129 /*****************************************************************************/
01130 
01133 void ec_fsm_master_state_write_sii(
01134         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
01135         )
01136 {
01137     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
01138     ec_sii_write_request_t *request = fsm->sii_request;
01139     ec_slave_t *slave = request->slave;
01140 
01141     if (ec_fsm_sii_exec(&fsm->fsm_sii)) return;
01142 
01143     if (!ec_fsm_sii_success(&fsm->fsm_sii)) {
01144         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to write SII data.\n");
01145         request->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_FAILURE;
01146         wake_up_all(&master->request_queue);
01147         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
01148         return;
01149     }
01150 
01151     fsm->sii_index++;
01152     if (fsm->sii_index < request->nwords) {
01153         ec_fsm_sii_write(&fsm->fsm_sii, slave,
01154                 request->offset + fsm->sii_index,
01155                 request->words + fsm->sii_index,
01156                 EC_FSM_SII_USE_CONFIGURED_ADDRESS);
01157         ec_fsm_sii_exec(&fsm->fsm_sii); // execute immediately
01158         return;
01159     }
01160 
01161     // finished writing SII
01162     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Finished writing %zu words of SII data.\n",
01163             request->nwords);
01164 
01165     if (request->offset <= 4 && request->offset + request->nwords > 4) {
01166         // alias was written
01167         slave->sii.alias = EC_READ_U16(request->words + 4);
01168         // TODO: read alias from register 0x0012
01169         slave->effective_alias = slave->sii.alias;
01170     }
01171     // TODO: Evaluate other SII contents!
01172 
01173     request->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_SUCCESS;
01174     wake_up_all(&master->request_queue);
01175 
01176     // check for another SII write request
01177     if (ec_fsm_master_action_process_sii(fsm))
01178         return; // processing another request
01179 
01180     ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
01181 }
01182 
01183 /*****************************************************************************/
01184 
01187 void ec_fsm_master_state_sdo_dictionary(
01188         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
01189         )
01190 {
01191     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
01192     ec_master_t *master = fsm->master;
01193 
01194     if (ec_fsm_coe_exec(&fsm->fsm_coe, fsm->datagram)) {
01195         return;
01196     }
01197 
01198     if (!ec_fsm_coe_success(&fsm->fsm_coe)) {
01199         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
01200         return;
01201     }
01202 
01203     // SDO dictionary fetching finished
01204 
01205     if (master->debug_level) {
01206         unsigned int sdo_count, entry_count;
01207         ec_slave_sdo_dict_info(slave, &sdo_count, &entry_count);
01208         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Fetched %u SDOs and %u entries.\n",
01209                sdo_count, entry_count);
01210     }
01211 
01212     // attach pdo names from dictionary
01213     ec_slave_attach_pdo_names(slave);
01214 
01215     ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
01216 }
01217 
01218 /*****************************************************************************/
01219 
01222 void ec_fsm_master_state_sdo_request(
01223         ec_fsm_master_t *fsm 
01224         )
01225 {
01226     ec_sdo_request_t *request = fsm->sdo_request;
01227 
01228     if (!request) {
01229         // configuration was cleared in the meantime
01230         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
01231         return;
01232     }
01233 
01234     if (ec_fsm_coe_exec(&fsm->fsm_coe, fsm->datagram)) {
01235         return;
01236     }
01237 
01238     if (!ec_fsm_coe_success(&fsm->fsm_coe)) {
01239         EC_SLAVE_DBG(fsm->slave, 1,
01240                 "Failed to process internal SDO request.\n");
01241         request->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_FAILURE;
01242         wake_up_all(&fsm->master->request_queue);
01243         ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
01244         return;
01245     }
01246 
01247     // SDO request finished
01248     request->state = EC_INT_REQUEST_SUCCESS;
01249     wake_up_all(&fsm->master->request_queue);
01250 
01251     EC_SLAVE_DBG(fsm->slave, 1, "Finished internal SDO request.\n");
01252 
01253     // check for another SDO request
01254     if (ec_fsm_master_action_process_sdo(fsm)) {
01255         return; // processing another request
01256     }
01257 
01258     ec_fsm_master_restart(fsm);
01259 }
01260
